text: NASA's groundbreaking Voyager 2 probe is
more than three decades into its epic
journey towards deep space on April 22nd
2010 just as the craft prepares to cross
the boundary into interstellar space it
mysteriously malfunctions it gets to
about 10 billion miles away from the
earth and all of a sudden it's setting
down data in a language that we don't
understand
you might even call it an alien language
someone or something has altered Voyager
Tunes communications system checking the
systems with another downlink that they
have they can tell nothing else is wrong
on the spacecraft it's just this one
system they suddenly realize wait a
minute then the complex binary codes
that command the computer system on
Voyager to a single digit has been
flipped from one to a zero it's almost
like somebody reprogrammed the probe the
flipping of one bit of data could
suggest that an unknown party has
intentionally interfered with voyagers
onboard computers
one trick that hackers like to use is
bit flipping cuz bit flipping can
actually shut down a computer and can
corrupt data the investigators
considered whether the possible hack
could have originated from Earth but the
distances involved make this highly
unlikely cook the big flippin beer
response to a message Voyager is
carrying into deep space the Voyager
space probe carried messages aboard
designed to be interpreted by any alien
life-forms they might encounter when
Voyager was launched it carried a record
of images and sounds from earth
scientists hope that one day another
civilization might pick up the messages
and make contact with mankind the
Voyager is sort of this intergalactic
hellosign it's us telling the universe
that we're here some speculate that if
the messages have been read by an
advanced race bit flip would be an
effective way of communicating with
earth did someone decide wow I'm gonna
respond but they don't speak English so
the message is a computer message is
that first contact if this is a coded
message investigators have yet to
decipher it after three weeks of bizarre
signals engineers managed to remotely
reset voyagers computers
the exact cause of the mysterious bit
flipping remains unknown
